body: Looks I assigned to myself by mistake.

some of these failures are unavailable, but seeing others fail with `Unknown` status:

```
object(stdClass)#522 (3) {
  ["metadata"]=>
  array(0) {
  }
  ["code"]=>
  int(2)
  ["details"]=>
  string(0) ""
}

2017-08-23 14:55:00,126 FAILED: cloud_to_prod_auth:default:php7:compute_engine_creds [ret=1, pid=25549]
```

```
Call did not complete successfully. Status object:
object(stdClass)#385 (3) {
  ["metadata"]=>
  array(0) {
  }
  ["code"]=>
  int(2)
  ["details"]=>
  string(0) ""
}

2017-08-23 14:55:00,192 FAILED: cloud_to_prod_auth:default:php7:jwt_token_creds [ret=1, pid=25611]
```

https://sponge.corp.google.com/target?id=c41e8c97-8ce4-4ce0-bc25-873846a1d95a&target=grpc/release/ubuntu/grpc_interop_toprod&searchFor=&show=ALL&sortBy=STATUS

Another slight variant of this from #12298:

https://grpc-testing.appspot.com/job/gRPC_interop_pull_requests/16298/testReport/junit/(root)/tests/cloud_to_prod_auth_default_php7_compute_engine_creds/

Here's the output:

```
Running test case compute_engine_creds
Call did not complete successfully. Status object:
object(stdClass)#522 (3) {
  ["metadata"]=>
  array(0) {
  }
  ["code"]=>
  int(14)
  ["details"]=>
  string(20) "Endpoint read failed"
}
```

https://sponge.corp.google.com/target?id=e4bfd950-0211-493b-a1ff-8f059c5f5f0f&target=grpc/release/ubuntu/grpc_interop_toprod&searchFor=&show=ALL&sortBy=STATUS

many `gateway_v4:*` failed in this run (on 1.6.x branch) with `Unknown` status

rather than an `unavailable` error, a `TIMEOUT: cloud_to_prod:gateway_v4:c++:server_streaming ` failure seen in https://sponge.corp.google.com/target?id=9c467327-2a07-4e89-84be-c69a42a74e0d&target=grpc/ubuntu/pull_request/grpc_interop_toprod&searchFor=&show=ALL&sortBy=STATUS

This really needs an assignee from C-core team (failures have been happening across multiple languages).
Assigning @yang-g  for now, feel free to reassign if busy or if there's a better fit.

I just saw the same failure with a go client:
2017-10-03 10:02:26,402 FATAL: 2017/10/03 17:02:26 &{0xc4204e00f0}.Recv() = rpc error: code = Unavailable desc = transport is closing
exit status 1

2017-10-03 10:02:26,402 FAILED: cloud_to_prod:gateway_v4:go:cancel_after_first_response [ret=1, pid=13762]

Will try to repro with a C++ client.

Java failure:
2017-10-04 13:05:00,124 Gradle is no longer run automatically. Make sure to run
'./gradlew installDist -PskipCodegen=true' or
'./gradlew :grpc-interop-testing:installDist -PskipCodegen=true' after any
changes. -PskipCodegen=true is optional, but requires less setup.

2017-10-04 13:05:00,124 FAILED: cloud_to_prod:gateway_v4:java:cancel_after_first_response [ret=1, pid=14108]
@matt-kwong  has enabled retries for pull request runs, so we are not seeing this on PRs (or seeing fairly rarely), but problem persists on master.

Here's a list of recent to_prod failures:
```

```

Dashboard: https://performanceedit-dot-grpc-testing.appspot.com/explore?dashboard=5711255578869760.
You can see the failing ones in upper right corner. 
One suggestion was to retry on the client sides for this non-hermetic environment. An easier way to achieve this is simply set allow_flakes to true for cloud-to-prod tests, instead of changing all test clients. 
@jtattermusch @dgquintas @a11r , thoughts?
I can repro. Seems like GFE is dropping the connection during client reading...

A lot of cloud_to_prod and cloud_to_cloud tests are timing out now.

https://sponge.corp.google.com/target?id=5ba5eb0f-4a1f-4cb3-9f79-8ecc37f2aebb&target=grpc/core/pull_request/linux/grpc_interop_toprod&searchFor=&show=ALL&sortBy=STATUS
@AspirinSJL , please file a new issue your latest finding. I don't think it's the same bug.
